questions.text: Rational use of medicines includes correct prescribing, dispensing, and adherence. It entails that patients receive medications appropriate to their clinical needs, in doses that meet their individual requirements, for an adequate period of time, and at the lowest cost to them. Which of the following is FALSE regarding rational prescribing?

options.label: A
options.text: Adequate monitoring of patient's adherence to medication

options.label: C
options.text: Appropriate drug in efficacy, tolerability, safety, and suitability of the patient

questions.correct_answer: B. Prescribing antibiotics for nonspecific diarrhea
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Prescribing antibiotics for nonspecific diarrhea Explanation: Prescribing antibiotics for viral fever and nonspecific diarrhea is irrational in prescribing All other options are rational prescribing

Highyeild:

According to duration: Acute Diarrhea Chronic Diarrhea ✓ Self limiting ✓Lasts from 2-3 days up to 2 weeks ✓ Lasts more than 2 weeks Causes May be due to: May be due to: ● Infection → (Infection induced diarrhea), caused by microorganisms. ● Diet→ (Diet induced diarrhea), results from food allergies. ● Drug→ (Drug induced diarrhea), results from medication. ● IBS ● Protozoal infection ● Malabsorption ● Pancreatic disease ● Hyperthyroidism

questions.text: A patient was suffering from diarrhea for the past 1 day. He had 4 episodes of diarrhea. On examination, the general condition was good, and vitals were stable. The fluid loss was found to be < 10% of body weight Which of the following is TRUE regarding rational prescribing?

options.label: A
options.text: Give ciprofloxacin + tinidazole combination to treat his diarrhea

options.label: B
options.text: Patient has to be hospitalized and start on iv fluids

options.label: C
options.text: Treating the fluid depletion with oral rehydration therapy

options.label: D
options.text: Most diarrhoeas are not self-limiting requiring aggressive therapy

questions.correct_answer: C. Treating the fluid depletion with oral rehydration therapy
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Treating the fluid depletion with oral rehydration therapy

Highyeild:

Advantages of low osmolarity ORS Increased efficacy of ORS in non cholera diarrhoea Need for unscheduled supplement IV therapy in children fell by 33%. Stool output decreased by 20%. Vomiting decreased by 30%. Safe & effective. Antibiotics are not indicated for the nonspecific diarrhea Here fluid loss is < 10%, hence iv fluid is not necessary. Iv fluids are indicated only if fluid loss is >10% of body weight ORS should be initiated to maintain hydration and adequate nutrition has to be given Most diarrheas are self-limiting

questions.text: The process of systematically finding, evaluating, and using contemporary research findings as the basis of clinical decisions. This is called?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Evidence-based medicine

Highyeild:

Evidence-based medicine - The process of systematically finding, evaluating, and using contemporary research findings as the basis of clinical decisions Experience-based medicine - clinical decisions are made based on experience

questions.text: A physician wants to start a drug on a patient. He wants to know whether this drug is effective against the diseases or not. He is checking the literature for the evidence. Which of the following is the highest level of evidence useful for the physician?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Meta-analysis

Highyeild:

Meta-analysis and systematic reviews are the highest levels of evidence–grade I evidence Grade II evidence- well-powered randomized controlled trial Grade III – open-label studies Grade IV – Case reports
